Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body a pale-red pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, exterior (cracked in a number of places) covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 7 wine of the Aten domain from the western river.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 45
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393147) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393147)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
